result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan R. Novosad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan R. Novosad is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan R. Novosad was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:56 am - Defendant Ryan R. Novosad in court with attorney Richard W. Voss.  Defendant Ryan R. Novosad in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information to be filed today in case 14cf120, which will mirror the criminal complaint - Voss in agreement.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.    Calling 13cf200, 13cf251 and 14cf120.  Plea questionnaire filed.  In case 13cf251 -  State moves to amend Count 1 to 961.41 (1)(e)3 a Class D Felony and Dismiss Count 2 - Granted.  In Case 14cf120 - State moves to dismiss count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Defendant has answered all the Court's questions appropriately.  Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Voss/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence 13cf200
WSP 3-1/2 yrs - 18 months Initial Confinement, 2 yrs Extended Supervision - Jail credit 49 days
Conditions of ES
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Follow through with out patient programming
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Court Sentence 13cf251
WSP 8 yrs - 4 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES - Jail credit 182 days CC to 13cf200
Condition of ES
CC/SF
Jury Fees $2,200.22
Restitution $1,005.84 (WF)
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Court Sentence 14cf120 
WSP 6 yrs - 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES - Jail credit 48 days - CC 13cf251 and 13cf200
Conditions of ES
CC/SF
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI, WEDS given to defendant
Eligible for CIP and SAP

02:32 pm - Defendant Ryan R. Novosad in court, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 13cf251 and 14cf120.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Defendant states Richard Voss withdrew from cases.  Defendant thought Voss was working on a global resolution for all three cases.  Court refers defendant to contact PD.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Invoices for transportation back to Wisconsin from Nebraska

02:06 pm - Defendant Ryan R. Novosad in court, via video, in custody.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek/Novosad statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Court transfer case to BR I.  Also calling 13cf251 (BBH) and 13cf200.  Court sets cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
